title: Santa Cruz’s 2022 Chameleon is a versatile trail thrasher
content:
Details from Santa Cruz were thin on the ground in the press pack about their 2022 Chameleon, the American brand’s do-it-all hardtail.

However, they did get the point across that this bike is as versatile as its name suggests. Santa Cruz has stayed true to its roots since it first launched the bike in 1997. It remains a do-it-all thrasher, from long-distance tourer to city-going single-speed, limited only by your imagination.

Mason Mashon

Following wider industry trends, the geometry of the new Chamelon has got a little bit longer, lower and slacker.

It is now also only available with a 29er front wheel, but the bike is still officially compatible with a 27.5″ rear wheel if you want to try out a mullet setup. The new Santa Cruz Chameleon is only available with an aluminium frame for now.

Reach has increased by 8mm on small, medium and large frames, while the extra-large gets a more subtle 3mm increase. 

Santa Cruz

The most significant change is the head tube angle, which shaves off 2.3 degrees and now sits at a shred-ready 65 degrees. The seat tube angle has been steepened to 74.3 degrees, an increase of 1.5 degrees over the outgoing model.

More subtle changes see the bottom bracket on the 29er Chameleon drop by 1mm to a 56mm bb drop. On the mullet version of the bike ( and there’s a 40mm bb drop on the MX bike (mixed wheels).

Santa Cruz

While the Chameleon keeps its changeable dropouts, the chainstay lengths have been increased on the new bikes, with the option of running them at 425mm or 437mm. That should give the bike more stability and help keep the weight distribution balanced with the longer reaches.

Finally, seat tubes have shorted, a benefit meaning you should be able to run longer dropper posts. The size small loses 5mm and now measures 380mm. There’s 10mm taken off the medium, 20mm off the large and 30mm from the extra-large, measuring 405mm, 430mm and 460mm, respectively.

2022 Santa Cruz Chameleon frame details

Many of the details remain the same for the new frame, and you can still choose to set it up single speed thanks to the changeable dropouts or tune the rear centre geometry to your preference.

Santa Cruz

There’s a standard water bottle mount inside the front triangle, while the triple cargo mounts under the down tube add the option to attach whatever you need if you plan to get off the beaten track and venture further afield.

There’s semi-internal cable routing and 1X drive train only with ISGC O5 tabs to mount a chain guide if you wish.

2022 Santa Cruz Chameleon models and pricing

Santa Cruz is producing three models of this new aluminium Chameleon, the D, R and S, all available in MX or 29in wheel options and in the four sizes: small, medium, large and extra-large.

Santa Cruz Chameleon D MX/29
